title: How are snowflakes' crystals symmetrical? - Quora

response.answer_text: Pretty much the same way you are symmetrical.    8)    Your left side didn't know what your right side was doing as you developed, either. A highly specific set of (atmospheric, in the case of a snowflake) conditions sets the stage for the specific geometric crystallization of a snowflake. Since those conditions are pretty nearly exactly the same in the entire vicinity surrounding a budding snowflake, the entire snowflake will take on the character dictated by those specific conditions.

I'm not sure all snowflakes are linearly symetric...i.e. right side matches left side.  I do think that all snowflakes are radially symetric though...meaning a single pattern is repeated in a circular manner.
